description:
Description
Immunizations received by children in Guatemala.
title: Immunization in Guatemala
reference:
These data are available at
http://data.princeton.edu/multilevel/guImmun.dat.  Multiple
indicator columns in the original data table have been collapsed to
factors for this data frame.

parameters.mom25p: a factor indicating if the mother was 25 years or older.
parameters.momWork:
a factor indicating if the mother had ever
worked outside the home.
parameters.ord:
an factor indicating the child's birth's order within the
family.  Levels are 01 - first child, 23 - second or
third child, 46 - fourth to sixth child, 7p -
seventh or later child.
parameters.momEd:
a factor describing the mother's level of eduation.
Levels are N - not finished primary, P - finished
primary, S - finished secondary
parameters.ethn:
a factor indicating the mother's ethnicity.  Levels are
L - Ladino, N - indigenous not speaking Spanish, and
S - indigenous speaking Spanish.
parameters.rural:
a factor indicating if the family's location is
considered rural or urban.
parameters.husEd:
a factor describing the husband's level of education.
Levels are the same as for momEd plus U - unknown.
parameters.kid2p:
a factor indicating if the child was 2 years or older
at the time of the survey.
parameters.immun:
a factor indicating if the child received a
complete set of immunizations. All children in this data frame
received at least one immunization.
parameters.pcInd81:
the percentage of indigenous population in the
community at the 1981 census.

format: A data frame with 2159 observations on the following 13 variables.
